Package edu.depauw.csc232.solitaire.ui

Class CardMover

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.depauw.csc232.solitaire.ui.CardMover
  • public class CardMover
extends java.lang.Object
    A CardMover is an object that is allowed to move cards from one Pile to another. It is the only legal way to do so from outside the ui package, because it is also responsible for keeping track of moves so that they may be undone/redone.
    Author:
    bhoward

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addDeck​(Pile pile)
      Add all 52 cards of a standard deck to the Pile.
      void addSuit​(Suit suit, Pile pile)
      Add all 13 cards of the given Suit to the Pile.
      void flipMove​(int numCards, Pile source, Pile target)
      Move the given number of cards from one Pile to the other, flipping them in the process.
      void flipTop​(Pile pile)
      Special case for pulling the top card from a pile, flipping it over, and putting it back.
      void move​(int numCards, Pile source, Pile target)
      Move the given number of cards from one Pile to the other.
      void shuffle​(Pile pile)
      Shuffle the cards in the given Pile.

    • Method Detail

      • addDeck

        public void addDeck​(Pile pile)
        Add all 52 cards of a standard deck to the Pile. Note: this move cannot be undone, so it should only be called on a CardMover that is going to be completed with Table's initialCommit method.
        Parameters:
        pile -

      • addSuit

        public void addSuit​(Suit suit,
                    Pile pile)
        Add all 13 cards of the given Suit to the Pile. Note: this move cannot be undone, so it should only be called on a CardMover that is going to be completed with Table's initialCommit method.
        Parameters:
        suit -
        pile -

      • flipMove

        public void flipMove​(int numCards,
                     Pile source,
                     Pile target)
        Move the given number of cards from one Pile to the other, flipping them in the process. The order of the cards will also be reversed, so that the top card of "source" will be under the remaining cards that are moved.
        Parameters:
        numCards -
        source -
        target -

      • flipTop

        public void flipTop​(Pile pile)
        Special case for pulling the top card from a pile, flipping it over, and putting it back.
        Parameters:
        pile -

      • move

        public void move​(int numCards,
                 Pile source,
                 Pile target)
        Move the given number of cards from one Pile to the other. The order of the cards will be preserved, so that the top card of "source" will become the top card of "target".
        Parameters:
        numCards -
        source -
        target -

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle​(Pile pile)
        Shuffle the cards in the given Pile. Note: this move cannot be undone, so it should only be called on a CardMover that is going to be completed with Table's initialCommit method.
        Parameters:
        pile -
